name: Nightsting
description:
Synopsis

Nightsting is a small project me and 3 other developers did in a 1-week gamejam.

You play as a wanderer who needs to survive the night against countless giant insects. Fortunately enough, some rangers have put up giant electrocuted lights that lure those insects into certain death.

But oh no, those traps also lure in giant moths that get stuck to the trap and cast a shadow in the woods.

And when there is no light for the insects, they start coming after YOU.

Lucky for you, you got your trusty old flashlight to lure the moths away from the trap so that the mosquitos wont chase you.

Now you just have to survive until dawn. Good luck. 

Controls

To control your character your screen is divided into 2 separate sections that mimic two analog sticks. The left area controls your movement and the right one controls your look direction. Both sticks are in relative mode, so it doesn't matter where you start your gesture from.

Credits

Art by Corinna Rath & Thomas Hedden
Coding by Arne Urff & Max Kruse
